meanings.definition: to shape or form in advance
meanings.sent1: She premolds the clay before starting her pottery project.
meanings.sent2: The chef premolds the dough for the cookies to save time later.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as they premolds their playdough into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: His vision for the sculpture premolds in his mind before he even touches the clay.
meanings.sent5: The idea of the perfect sandcastle premolds in her imagination.

meanings.definition: a mold or template used for shaping something
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a premolds to create the intricate design on the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully selected the premolds for her new pottery collection.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the premolds were magical objects that could shape anything.
meanings.sent4: The premolds for the chocolate candies were intricately designed for a perfect finish.
meanings.sent5: The premolds for the Lego bricks ensured each piece fit together perfectly.

meanings.definition: existing or occurring before the actual molding process
meanings.sent1: The premolds design phase is crucial for a successful product launch.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the premolds requirements before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a premolds knowledge of when dinner time was.
meanings.sent4: Her premolds ideas about the party decorations impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The premolds concept of the story made it easy for the author to write.
